alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:01PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT APACHE AND NAVAJO COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM MST... At 301 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Taylor, or 22 miles north of Show Low, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylor and Snowflake. This includes the following highways... State Route 277 between mile markers 333 and 336. State Route 77 between mile markers 359 and 371. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
